meanings.definition: To buy or acquire before something else
meanings.sent1: I decided to prepurchase the concert tickets to ensure we get good seats.
meanings.sent2: She always likes to prepurchase her groceries online to save time at the store.
meanings.sent3: John thought it would be funny to prepurchase a snow shovel in the middle of summer.
meanings.sent4: The wise squirrel would prepurchase nuts before winter to avoid scarcity.
meanings.sent5: The students were advised to prepurchase their textbooks early to avoid the rush.

meanings.definition: The act of buying or acquiring before something else
meanings.sent1: The prepurchase of the limited edition sneakers was a smart move by the collector.
meanings.sent2: Online stores often offer discounts for prepurchases of new video games.
meanings.sent3: The prepurchase of the movie tickets turned out to be a great decision as the show was sold out.
meanings.sent4: The prepurchase of the concert tickets felt like securing a piece of happiness in advance.
meanings.sent5: The prepurchase of the latest smartphone model created a buzz among tech enthusiasts.
